page.title: 12MARYC.EDUCATION HANDICAPPED
page.content: Camphill is part of the Rudolf Steiner community.In 22 acres of park and woodland 206 handicapped children are cared for by 60 workers.Children fit enough attend classes in school.There are Guides,Scouts and sports.There is a large library.Children in Germany made furniture for them.Herbs are grown for medicines.The community bakes it's own bread.Bees are also kept.The children live in Scandinavian style houses,the families consisting of different ages and handicaps,so each can afford mutual help.Craft work of a very high standard is produced and sold.The children have pets: cats, rabbits,ponies and goldfish.It is a remarkably happy place.
